agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.
service_description: Maintains drop-off sites around Newton County for collecting recyclables including: flattened corrugated cardboard and  box board, glass, plastics (1-5, 7), aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, newspapers, and magazines. Call for information on recycling in nearby towns.
site_details: Walk in, email, call, or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site
site_eligibility: Residential households in the county

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a soup kitchen.
service_description: Provides a free, hot dinner each week to persons in need.
site_details: Dine in: Walk in -- Carry-out: Walk in and fill a to-go box. -- Pre-order pick up: Pre-order your meals by 4pm and drive-thru pick up starting at 5pm.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers delivery of requested library materials to homebound persons in the town of Brook and of Washington township in Newton County.
site_details: Call to request delivery or visit the website.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed and Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Living in the town of Brook or of Washington township -- Home-bound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.

site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed and Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in the town of Brook or Washington township

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry. Clothing may sometimes be available.
service_name: FAITH HARVEST FOOD AND CLOTHING PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and gently used clothing to those in need. Clients make their own selections. Food pantry deliveries made to homebound clients once a month. Sizes and types of clothing available depends on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Be prepared to complete contact information and income form. -- May send a proxy for family member or caregiver to pick up food but requires a completed proxy form every six months. -- Homebound clients may request a monthly delivery.
site_eligibility: Living in Newton County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Newton County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to persons in need in Newton County, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.
site_eligibility: Homeowners -- Mobile home occupants -- Low income

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Newton County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Newton County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty sandbags to Newton County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon 9am-8pm; Tues and Thurs 11am-6pm; Wed 1pm-8pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in Jefferson Township or the town of Kentland

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food items to persons in need within the North Newton School District. Toiletries and cleaning supplies are generally available. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive thru procedures in affect. Pull up and park on the far west side of the church and a volunteer will come to your car.
site_eligibility: Living in North Newton School District area and within Newton, Lake, Shelby, or Schneider County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to Newton County persons in need.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Frozen meat may also be available occasionally. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Newton County -- Limit one visit per calendar month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to Newton County persons in need.
service_description: Provides door-to-door transportation services to medical and non-medical appointments within 120 miles of Morocco for Newton County persons in need. Out of state trips not permitted. All transportation services are based on driver availability; advance scheduling is required.
site_details: Call to make reservations; services must be scheduled at least two weeks in advance of travel.
site_eligibility: Living in Newton County -- In need of transportation to an in-state appointment within 120 miles of Morocco

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Newton County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
